availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Martin (Taylor County, KY, house carpenter)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, house carpenter. Kentucky native. Son of Matilda Martin. Married to Lucy E. Mason Martin in Taylor County on March 15, 1860. Student in Taylor County in 1850. House carpenter in Taylor County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 195B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 664.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 229A.
Find A Grave, "William T. Martin (1834-unknown)," Memorial 72424882, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72424882 (accessed February 18, 2020).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Taylor County Courthouse, Kentucky, Taylor County Marriages, Film #000983728, pp. 184 and 685.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 4th Congressional District, Vol. 3, n.d., (Accessed via ancestry.com on February 18, 2020), p. 118 of microfilm.
